deep.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: going far down from the top or from the surface
deep.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The castle is on an island surrounded by a deep lake.
The swimming pool has a deep end and a shallow end for kids.
We’ll take the boat out into deep water where we can dive.
deep.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: you use deep to say what distance something goes down from the top or surface
deep.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: In places, the snow was waist-deep  (=deep enough to reach a person’s waist).
Dig a hole around 12 inches deep.
deep.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: going far in from the outside or from the front edge of something
deep.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: She was sitting in a deep leather chair.
deep.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Despite the peace process, there are deep divisions in the community.
The country is in a deep recession.
Evan will be in deep trouble if he is caught.
deep.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a deep breath or sigh is one in which you breathe a lot of air in or out
deep.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: She stopped and took a deep breath.
Tom gave a deep sigh of relief.
deep.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a deep feeling, belief etc is very strong and sincere
deep.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: May I express my deepest sympathy.
The letters show her deep affection for him.
He has a deep understanding of the environment.
deep.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a deep sound is very low
deep.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: Her laugh was deep and loud.
I love that deep bass line.
deep.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: a deep colour is dark and strong
deep.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: She gazed at him with wide deep blue eyes.
The berries are a deep red colour.
deep.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: important but complicated or difficult to understand
deep.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: These problems are too deep for me.
There is a deep issue of principle involved.
deep.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: if someone is in a deep sleep, it is difficult to wake them
deep.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: He lay down and fell into a deep sleep.
deep.translation[0].definitions[10].defi: a deep person is serious and intelligent, but is hard to know well
deep.translation[0].definitions[10].exam: Henry has always been a deep one. He keeps his views to himself.
deep.translation[0].definitions[11].defi: a deep ball is hit, thrown, or kicked to a far part of the sports field
deep.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a long way into or below the surface of something
deep.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Some bones were hidden deep beneath the ground.
The tunnel led deep under the mountains.
We were deep in a tropical rainforest  (=far from the edge of the forest).
Tom stared deep into her eyes.
They talked deep into the night  (=very late).
